column3: str
The assigned venture will be abandoned as it is no longer available.
Unable to use <SheetEn(Item,2,IntegerParameter(1),1,1)/>. You must first assign a class for your retainer.
Unable to use <SheetEn(Item,2,IntegerParameter(1),1,1)/>. Your retainer has already attained level <Value>IntegerParameter(2)</Value>.
Your retainer cannot exceed your own level.
You can only advance your retainer as far as level <Value>IntegerParameter(1)</Value>, to match your current level. Do you wish to proceed?
You do not have <SheetEn(Item,1,IntegerParameter(1),1,1)/> in your possession.
Give <SheetEn(Item,2,IntegerParameter(1),1,1)/> to your retainer?
Advance retainer to level <Value>IntegerParameter(1)</Value>.
You have not yet received approval to hire retainers.
You have not yet hired a retainer.
Your retainer did not respond.
The bell does not seem to be functioning...
You cannot summon that retainer unless you resume payment for their services.
You cannot change your retainer's class/job until all gear has been removed.
Your retainer has not been assigned a venture.

Your retainer is qualified to be trained in more advanced traditions. Select <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Assign retainer a job<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> to proceed.

To train your retainer in a more advanced tradition, select <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Assign retainer a job<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> to proceed.
To assign your retainer a job, you must purchase <SheetEn(Item,1,IntegerParameter(1),1,1)/> from a retainer vocate and have it in your inventory.
You cannot assign your retainer the <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/> job until all gear has been removed.
You cannot assign your retainer the <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/> job until they have achieved level <Value>IntegerParameter(2)</Value>.

You cannot assign your retainer the <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/> job until you achieve level <Value>IntegerParameter(2)</Value> as <If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),10))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),14))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),5))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),26))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),33))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/>a <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/></If></If></If></If></If>.

You cannot assign your retainer the <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/> job until you yourself achieve a higher level as <If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),10))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),14))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),5))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),26))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),33))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/>a <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/></If></If></If></If></If>.
Unable to proceed. You do not have <SheetEn(Item,1,IntegerParameter(1),1,1)/> in your possession.

Your retainer has become <If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),10))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),14))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),5))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),26))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(1),33))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/><Else/>a <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(1),0)/></If></If></If></If></If>!
You were unable to assign your retainer a job.
Your retainer has attained sufficient experience to be assigned a job. Would you like to do so?

Entrust your copy of <Emphasis>Modern Vocation</Emphasis> to your retainer and bid them learn the ways of the <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/>?

<UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Please note that retainers cannot change jobs without resetting all progress.<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
Assign job.
Your retainer's copy of <Emphasis>Modern Vocation</Emphasis> will be permanently discarded. Are you sure you wish to proceed?

Reset <Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight>'s class/job?
(<Clickable(<Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/>)/>: Level <Value>IntegerParameter(3)</Value>)
<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>※Resetting will revert this class/job to level 1.<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
<If(Equal(IntegerParameter(5),1))><UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>※Retainer venture history will also be reset.<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
<Else/></If>
Reset class/job.
Return.
You must select a class for your retainer before you assign a venture.
Select a category.
Hunting.
Field Exploration.
Mining.
Highland Exploration.
Botany.
Woodland Exploration.
Fishing.
Waterside Exploration.
As a Disciple of War or Magic, your retainer will be able to undertake hunting and field exploration ventures.
As a miner, your retainer will be able to undertake mining and highland exploration ventures.
As a botanist, your retainer will be able to undertake botany and woodland exploration ventures.
As a fisher, your retainer will be able to undertake fishing and waterside exploration ventures.
You have not yet unlocked this class and therefore cannot assign it to your retainer.

<Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight> will become <If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),10))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),14))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),5))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),26))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),33))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/>a <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/></If></If></If></If></If>. Are you certain you wish to proceed?

<Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight> is no longer <If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),10))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),14))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),5))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),26))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),33))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/>a <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/></If></If></If></If></If>.
You must assign your retainer a class before viewing attributes and gear.
You cannot reset the class/job of a retainer with a venture that has not been completed.
You are about to reset your retainer's class/job. Please note that this process cannot be reversed, and all progress will be permanently lost. Are you certain you wish to proceed?
Your retainer will be unable to process item buyback requests once recalled. Are you sure you wish to proceed?
A venture promissory note cannot be used as is; you must first redeem it for ventures. The amount of ventures you possess is shown in the Currency window.
You do not have any ventures in your inventory and therefore cannot assign your retainer a venture.
Ventures can be acquired through a variety of methods such as exchanging company seals, fulfilling leve objectives, and completing allied society quests.
If you possess a venture promissory note, you may redeem it for ventures through a Calamity salvager.
Quick Exploration.
Your retainer is now experienced enough to undertake <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>quick exploration ventures<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
Select <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>assign venture<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> from the retainer menu to proceed.
Check the Companion App for ventures pending completion before assigning a new venture.
You can now send your retainers afield on procurement expeditions known as <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>ventures<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
Before you can do so, however, you must first assign them a class.
After summoning a retainer, select <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>assign retainer class<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> from the retainer menu to begin.
Your retainer cannot undertake ventures until you assign his or her class.
This can be any one class, with the exception of those of the Disciples of the Hand.
Your retainer's class determines which ventures he or she can embark upon.
Please be advised that you cannot assign your retainer a class you have not yet unlocked.

<Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight> has become <If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),10))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),14))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),5))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),26))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),33))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/>a <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/></If></If></If></If></If>!
You must now equip a main arm to your retainer.
Select <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>view retainer attributes and gear<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> from the retainer menu to proceed.

<Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight> has become <If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),10))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),14))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),5))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),26))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(2),33))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/><Else/>a <Sheet(ClassJob,IntegerParameter(2),0)/></If></If></If></If></If>!
Please be advised that your retainer must be equipped with a main arm in order to undertake ventures.
If you wish to assign your retainer a different class, you must first reset his or her current class.
If necessary, recall your retainer and remove all gear to proceed.
You can equip any item in your inventory or Armoury Chest to your retainer, so long as he or she meets the requirements.
Equip a main arm to your retainer to proceed.
You have equipped a main arm to <Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight>!
Your retainer is now duly prepared to undertake ventures.
Select <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>assign venture<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> from the retainer menu to proceed.
As you may recall, the ventures your retainer can undertake are determined by his or her class.
There are two main types of ventures which you can assign your retainer.
Hunting, Mining, Botany, and Fishing constitute one type, in which you specify an item for your retainer to procure.
Exploration ventures constitute the second type, in which your retainer will scour the terrain of your choosing for (hopefully) precious items.
However, your retainer will not undertake a venture without first receiving due compensation.
Assigning a venture requires a payment in a unique currency of the same name─<UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>ventures<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
Ventures can be acquired through a variety of methods such as exchanging company seals, fulfilling leve objectives, and completing allied society quests.
You have assigned <Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight> a venture!

To confirm the time remaining until a venture is complete, select <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Timers<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> under Duty from the <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>main menu<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>, and select <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Ventures<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.

You can also confirm the time remaining by selecting <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>view venture report<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> from the retainer menu.
Should you wish to cancel the venture and recall your retainer, you may do so when viewing the venture report.
However, please be advised that this is not necessary unless you wish to assign a different venture to your retainer.
Even with a venture in progress, you can still entrust or withdraw items and gil, or sell items on the market.
<Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight> has completed a venture!

To claim the fruits of your retainer's labor, select <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>view venture report<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> from the retainer menu.
<Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight> has gained experience for completing a venture!
Like you, your retainer can gain experience and levels.
This, in turn, will allow your retainer to undertake a wider variety of ventures, yielding more desirable items.
Moreover, equipping additional gear to your retainer will increase both the quantity and quality of the items procured.
Quick exploration ventures are brief assignments in which you dispatch your retainer without instruction.
The items your retainer procures on these ventures can range from worthless to priceless.
Moreover, the experience your retainer receives for completing a quick exploration venture is determined by their level.
Although it is impossible to predict the results of these ventures, the potential benefits should not be underestimated.
Glamours can be applied to gear equipped by or in the possession of your retainers.
Moreover, gear equipped by or in the possession of your retainers can be used to apply glamours to your equipped gear, or gear in your inventory.
Please note a glamour prism is required for each piece of gear you wish to glamour.
Dyes can be used to change the color of any gear equipped by or in the possession of your retainers.
I have come, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If>.
Nothin' fer ye to worry about.
You summoned?
Yes? <sigh> I hope this doesn't take long...
You wish to see how a master handles a bazaar?
Hello, hello! You called?
At your service, my <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lady<Else/>lord</If>.
What's it to be this time, love?
What would you ask?
I'm so sorry to keep you waiting, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. So very, very sorry.
Quickly now, I've places to be.
Well, if it ain't my favorite client! Always a pleasure, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>!
Yes, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>? What is your bidding?
What's on the agenda, chief? Deprivin' saps o' their hard-earned gil?
I have come. You may proceed.
Oh, hello there. To what do I owe the pleasure?
I am come to conduct business, and only business.

You look to be in good health, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. How may I assist you this fine <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>eve<Else/>morn</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>eve</If></If>?
What is it you would have me do, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>?
Usually, it's me doin' the summons and others doin' the waitin'.
Is there something that I can help you with?
Oh, why must you summon me at a time like this...?
I'm sure there is a perfectly good explanation for this summons.
You know, I thought you might be along to summon me. You may rest assured that I am ready and eager to serve.
Hail to thee, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. Your humble servant has heard your summons.
Greetin's and salutations, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>. Pray speak yer desires, an' I'll do me damndest to see 'em done.
I was wondering when you'd get around to calling me.
Mind if we keep this brief? I've got a pretty little thing that's waitin' for me.
What?
I'm here, I'm here!
Here I am, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If>, as per your request.
'Ello, dearie. What's on the docket?
I never miss a chance to line these pockets.
Well, this is unexpected! What'll it be?
What is it now?
Here I aaaaaam!
How may I be of serrrvice, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>?
It's a war out there, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>. You have no idea.
Business or pleasure?
I presume you did not summon me solely for the pleasure of my company.
Just the <If(PlayerParameter(4))>fair maiden<Else/>handsome fellow</If> I was hoping to see! Tell me your heart's desire.
I hope your catcall is not one of disapproval.
Ye rang, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>?
A cat's ears do not miss much―least of all a summons.
Curiosity called the cat. What do you have for me today?
Ready when you are.
I was just thinking of you!
What need have you of me today, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>?
Bwahahaha! Ye got work needs gettin' done? Just point me in the right bloody direction.
I've come. What is it?
Hey there─hic─<If(PlayerParameter(4))>missy<Else/>mate</If>! Care to join me fer a pint?
Couldn't come no quicker. Where's the work?
I came runnin' soon as I heard the bell! Ye need somethin', chief?
I am at your disposal, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>.
Ye got somethin' fer me, cap'n?
Go ahead, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>.
Let's keep this short and sweet, shall we?
This wouldn't be necessary if you entrusted your financial affairs to me.
So─sellin', buyin', drinkin', whorin'? What's it to be today?
Greetings, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. How may I be of service?
What'll it be, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>mate</If>?
State your business.

And how does this wonderful <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>evening<Else/>day</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>evening</If></If> find you?
Well... Here I am...<If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If>.

We work the market stalls,♪
And our uniforms are pretty;♪
We are sober men and true,♪
And attentive to our duties!♪
<If(PlayerParameter(4))>My lady<Else/>My lord</If>. What would you ask of me?
So. We doing this?
Yes?
Hey, it's...it's you! Hello again, you!
I-It's not like I want to sell your items or anything.
What do you have for me? Come on, come on! Don't be shy!
You rang, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>?
I trust this will be worth my while.
<Emphasis>What</Emphasis>?
Whatever you need, leave it to me! I have my methods.
Gahaha! If it isn't my favorite <If(PlayerParameter(4))>mistress<Else/>master</If>!
It is I, your most loyal and capable retainer!
You summoned me, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>?
At your beck an' call, I am!
You called, and I have come.
At last─I thought you'd <Emphasis>never</Emphasis> call. What does <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If> need of me?
Could it be...? The famous <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/> has called on <Emphasis>me</Emphasis>? <chuckle>
Yes, yes, here I am! Ready at a moment's notice!
What will it be, love?
Your orders! I would hear them at once!
If there is something you would ask of me, then ask it.
Yes...? Is there something you─<yawn>─need?
A task for me? I hope it's something fun!
I am here to do your every bidding, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If>! Ask of me anything at all!

I have been awaiting your summons, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. What would you have of me this fine <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>evening<Else/>morning</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>evening</If></If>?
What can I do for ye, yer <If(PlayerParameter(4))>ladyship<Else/>lordship</If>?
You called, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>...?
You─hic─rang?
Need my assistance, do you? Let's make this quick, then.
You have my ear, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>. Both of them, in fact!
If that is all, I will take my leave now, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If>.
Take care o' yerself, hear?
Until we next meet.
Well, it's about time. Good-bye.
I believe thanks are in order.
I'm off, then!
With your leave, my <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lady<Else/>lord</If>.
Don't you worry 'bout a thing. I got this.
Farewell, then.
If there is nothing else, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, I'll be going now.
Is that all? Very well, until next time.
Oh, will that be all today? Very well, but promise me you'll come back soon!
As always, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, it has been an honor and a privilege.
You can count on me, chief─I know how to get things done.
Don't be a stranger.
I swear it shall be done. Eventually.
As you wish.
Capital! I shall carry out your orders forthwith.
I humbly await your next summons, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>.
Don't leave me alone for too long, hear?
Always a pleasure.
That will be all, yes? Then if you would excuse me...
I believe that concludes our dealings for now.
Are you certain you don't desire anything else? Anything at all? Very well, I shall take my leave.
Your every whim shall be swiftly carried out with due care and consideration.
Shouldn't take more than a moment, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>.
I'll be going, then.
Thank the gods we're finished. I've got plans to put my hands in places I've never seen...if you know what I mean.
Be well.
I'm off, I'm off!
Until we meet again!
Blessin's o' the Twelve upon ye.
May Nald'thal see fit to fatten our pockets!
Very good, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>! Your wish is my command, and so forth.
You know how to reach me.
Is it time for good-byes already? I'm going to miss you...
Thy will be done.
The markets may be a bleedin' battlefield, but I'm a godsdamned soldier. You can count on me, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>.
Why so serrrious? <sigh> So it goes.
I hardly think that warranted my personal appearance, but what is done is done.
Then I have satisfied your every need? Excellent! I do so take pleasure in servicing my clients.
Good-bye for now, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sirrr</If>.
Right then, let's get on with it!
There is no call for concerrrn.
When the master's away, the cat will play.
Gods, this is tirin'...
You don't want to be with me anymore? <sniffle>
I shall carry out your wishes as instructed, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>.
Bwahahaha! I'm in yer bazaar, sellin' yer wares!
I will go now.
Awww, bugger. Reckon I best get to work...
I don't do good-byes.
Go and grab yourself some shut-eye, chief. You look terrible!
Will that be all for today, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>? Understood.
Aye, aye, cap'n!
Duly noted.
Not exactly how I was hopin' to spend my day, but I suppose it can't be helped.
Ours is not to reason why. Ours is but to do and die.
Ever the consummate professional, I see. Another time, then.
If there is nothing else, then I shall take my leave.
Is that all? Guess I'll be on my way, then.
Any last requests? Very well. Heh heh heh... Ahem.
Ah, yes, of course. Duty calls!
You are finished with me, then?

Here today and gone tomorrow;♪
Yes, I know─♪
That is so!♪
If ever you have need of me, just ring.
Always a pleasure, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If>.
Right, then.
Finished already? Guess that's that, then.
You're leaving already? Fine, then! I-It's not like I wanted you to stay or anything.
Very good, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>! Very good indeed!
Always a pleasure to serve, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>.
Hmph. I hope that next time you will have a more meaningful task for me.
<Emphasis>Good-bye</Emphasis>.
And with that, I shall be off. Places to go, people to see.
Bahahaha! Till next time, my friend!
Ring for me whenever you please! You know that I will never let you down!
I'm glad to have been of service. Mind you don't overdo things, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>.
Had your fill of me, eh? Fair enough! Let me know if you need aught else!
We're done? Then I take my leave.
There's naught else <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If> requires? I'll be sharpening my claws, then, waiting for your next summons.
Nothing else? Right... I'll be off!
Have everything you need? I'll take a little nap, then.
Must we part so soon?
And I am off!
Call on me as you please. If I am so inclined, I will answer.
That is all, I suppose...? <yawn> Very well...
That is all? Oh, I was hoping there'd be more...
Is that all you need of me? But I could yet serve you in so many ways!
Do not hesitate to call upon me again. Fare you well in your endeavors, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>.
Just say the word, yer <If(PlayerParameter(4))>ladyship<Else/>lordship</If>, and I'll be here with bells on.
If you have no further need of my services...
I'm off for another glass, then. You know where to find me!
What─is that it? Are you <Emphasis>sure</Emphasis> you need a retainer?
Nothing else? Then I shall be hopping along.
Your bidding will be done, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If>.
Easy now, easy. I'm on it.

<yawn> Oh...that's right. I had something to tell you.
I've returned! Come now, are you not happy to see me?
I could scarcely wait to return to your side, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If>!
I am returned! And I have come bearing a gift.
About damn time! My ears were twitching summat fierce listening out for that bell...
I believe this concludes your venture, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>...
I have returned, and gods have I worked up a thirst! Oh, and this is for you!
I did what you asked. You'll be wanting my full report, then?
Wait until you see the goods I got my paws on!
Oh, my adorable sapling! You have need of <Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight>, yes? But sing the word, and let your beautiful branch do what only they can.
A whispered word, and off goes <Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight> on a grand adventure! What wonders await at journey's end?
Carried by the wind, the leaf flutters to the ground─and so does <Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight> return to your side. Was the journey a fruitful one?
You have no more need of <Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight>? So be it! I shall steal quietly from your loyal servant's dreams.
Very well. I shall slip quietly from <Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight>'s dreams. May your leaf flutter, float, and find a way back to you.

From verdant green to glittering gold, so does the leaf take on delightful hues with each new season. If you would see <Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight> dressed in new colors, your beautiful branch will attend to the task.
